file_content.text: You got what you wanted, now please leave me alone.
Nothing like a bottle of Somnaskol Red to brighten Regg's day.
Regg says you know Andronikos Revel.
Ha! I hate to break it to you, sweetie, but Regg'd lie to his own grandmother.
Him's the one that's been doing business with Andronikos. I never seen the guy in my life.
But... for a price, I can tell you how to get old Regg to give up any information you want.
Enough! [Shock.]
Aaaaah!
All right, all right. So I know Andronikos. Please, just don't do that again.
You gotta promise not to tell him I told you, okay? He'll kill me if he finds out.
He won't hear it from me.
I won't tell.
I'll do far worse if you don't tell.
And?
The more I hear about this pirate the better it gets.
Sounds like my kind of guy.
Andronikos keeps a room on the second floor of the cantina. I haven't seen him leave all day.
But I really wouldn't go up there if I was you. Andronikos ain't exactly friendly.
You tell me how to get Regg to talk, and I won't kill you.
Let's make a deal.
I can pay well if you can tell me what I want.
100 credits, then.
I think that'll do it. Thank you.
Take this bottle to Regg. It's a rare drink called Somnaskol Red.
Costs a month's pay, which is why I had to charge for it. But wave it in Regg's face, and he'll crumble.
I don't have that kind of money.
I'm broke.
Well then, good luck getting Regg to talk.
Tell me now.
Let me put this another way.
All right, all right, no need to get all crazy-eyed.
Take this bottle to Regg. It's Somnaskol Red, a rare drink.
It costs a small fortune. So you can't blame me for trying to make the money back, right?
I always get what I want.
Big mistake. [Shock.]
Argh!
Fine, fine. Take--take this bottle to him. It's Somnaskol Red, a rare drink.
Costs--costs a month's pay to buy. You can't blame me for wanting to make some of it back, can you?
Sorry, I'm busy, sweetie.
I'm looking for a pirate named Andronikos Revel.
A--andronikos? Sorry, never heard of him.
But you might ask old Regg. He, uh, knows a bit more about the clientele.
Think about your answer carefully this time.
Try again. [Shock her.]
Aaaaah!
Which one's Regg?
Regg?
At the bar. He owns the joint.
They look more like bums to me.
Clientele, huh.
Yeah, well, I think Regg's thinking is, they pay the bills.
Regg knows everybody. So if you're looking for someone, you should ask him.
Talk to Regg, I betcha he knows that Andronikos feller.
You again? I told you, I don't know nobody named Andronikos.
Now what's this you got here?
Your job--unless you tell me where Andronikos is.
What do you think?
Blackmail? Please, Sith, this is the only job I got.
Regg's firing you, you lazy no-good bum.
I hate to break it to you.
He thinks he can get rid of me? I'll scratch his eyes out! I'll get Andronikos to gut him in his sleep!
But I thought you didn't know any Andronikos.
Oh really?
Just tell me where he is, and I'll get him for you.
Now we're in business.
You don't mean the person I'm looking for who you don't know?
That's strange.
You--you tricked me! You and Regg both. This was all just a scheme to get me in trouble.
That's none of your concern. Tell me where Andronikos is!
Nothing. [Shock her]
Aaaaah!
You're--you're terrible. All this just to find that damned pirate! You're sick!
Fine, I'll tell you. But you didn't hear it from me, okay? Andronikos'd kill me--or worse.
Now what do you want with me?
I hate it when people lie to me.
You lied to me.
Now, look, don't take it personal, see. Andronikos said he'd kill me if I told, and I believe him.
So please, you gotta promise me, you won't tell him who you heard it from.
Your boss Regg says you know where Andronikos is.
You know what I want.
Does he, huh? Well, I wouldn't believe anything that old Rodian says. Regg'd lie to his own grandmother.
Unlike you, he's smart enough not to lie to a Sith.
He's still better than you.
I am not Regg's grandmother.
Then I'm lucky.
Fool. [Shock.]
I want you to scream, and then I want you to tell me everything you know about Andronikos Revel.
The truth. [Shock.]
